SENT.plain: A 65-year-old man was admitted for dysuria
He had been irradiated 60Co for malignant lymphoma of tonsils 2 years earlier
The findings of palpation of prostate, retrograde urethrogram and urethroscopy strongly suggested benign prostatic hypertrophy
Retropubic prostatectomy was performed and 18 g of "adenoma" was resected
By histological observation, the "adenoma" proved to be malignant lymphoma
This tumor belonged to follicular lymphoma, medium-sized cell type of LSG non-Hodgkin's lymphoma classification
After the operation, he left our hospital for a personal reason and received systemic chemotherapy at another hospital
